stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.

Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.

stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.

Polishing their boots with bacon grease.

preGame:
LADIES, GENTLEMEN, AND THOSE STUCK IN THE VOID BETWEEN! WELCOME to a very special, very intoxicating edition of Tuesday Night Trollball! üéôÔ∏èüëπ

We are LIVE from the sun-drenched sands of The Buccaneer's Bowl at the Toast Island Resort! I hope you packed your sunscreen and your liver medication, folks, because tonight is an **OPEN BAR MATCH**! üçª That's right! The taps are flowing, the inhibitions are gone, and the violence is guaranteed to be sloppy! üçπ

Tonight, we have a faction family feud! A Cedar Hill Civil War! In the visiting corner, freezing their fur off, we have **The South Pole Yetis**! ‚ùÑÔ∏è And defending the resort, it's **The Tortell Privateers**! üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è Both teams are looking for their first win, and frankly, they're looking for the bottom of a bottle too!

I've been down in the locker rooms, and let me tell you, the vibes are weird! The Yetis' healer, Seiter Aida, was seen *smelling their own socks* from the last match! ü§¢ Whatever works to wake you up, I guess! Meanwhile, Udela Dorkus is preparing for the match by LICKING A WHETSTONE! Now that is the kind of iron deficiency I can respect! üëÖ‚öîÔ∏è

On the home side, the Privateers are getting weird too. Lilithe Royce is sticking LEECHES to their legs! Yes! Drain that bad blood before the enemy spills it! I love it! üòç

Imra might be the master of elixirs, and Elspeth Ortell might be the friendliest lady in the realm, but tonight, friendship is canceled! It's time for drunken brawls and leather balls! Grab a drink, find a seat, and prepare for CHAOS! üîîüç∑
postGame:
HOLY HANGOVERS, BATMAN! ü¶á What a slobber‚Äîwait, I can't say that word! WHAT A BOMBASTIC DISPLAY OF BOOZE AND BRUTALITY! üçªüí•

The dust has settled, the vomit has been mopped up, and the **South Pole Yetis** have absolutely ICEBERG'D the competition, shutting out the home team with a decisive **5 to 0** victory! üßäüèÜ

The game started with more violence than a family reunion in the Demon Prison! The Privateers came out swinging! Ellan Elburt and Keisling Damalas were handing out concussions like they were free drink tokens! Keisling absolutely flattened Sale Tocci and Ajit Serge early on! üöë But you know what they say: You can't win if you can't score, and the Privateers couldn't find the goal with a map and a flashlight!

The Yetis, however, played through the pain and the alcohol! Sayers Erdda broke the deadlock with a beautiful shot from Home Field! BAM! 2-0! üéØ And that's when the liquor really kicked in! ü•¥

Folks, the second half was a mess! Coussoule Bidle was so tipsy they threw a pass straight to the Privateers' Lilithe Royce! Intercepted! But could the Privateers capitalize? NO! They were stumbling around like toddlers on a tilt-a-whirl! üé°ü§Æ

Jessy Debbie‚Äîoh, sweet Jessy‚Äîran through the drunken haze and DUNKED that troll head right into the basket! 3-0! üèÄ The Privateers were looking greener than Joslyn's greenhouse at this point! ü§¢

And to cap it all off, Ajit Serge, swaying like a palm tree in a hurricane, managed to launch a final shot to seal the deal! 5-0! üèÅ

The Privateers' healer, Eugen Zacks, worked overtime today, reviving player after player, but he couldn't cure their inability to score! Elspeth Ortell, I hope you have some of that "ritual sangria" ready, because your boys are going to need it to forget this performance! üç∑ü§°

So there you have it! The South Pole Yetis walk away with the win and the bragging rights in Cedar Hill! The Privateers walk away... well, they crawl away! Until next time, I'm Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that violence is the only universal language! GOODNIGHT OSTERRA! üåôüíÄ
